meanings.definition: To bring back to one's own country.
meanings.sent1: After many years abroad, she finally decided to start patriating back to her homeland.
meanings.sent2: The soldier was patriating after serving in a foreign land for a long time.
meanings.sent3: The cat, tired of exploring, began patriating back to its cozy home.
meanings.sent4: The memories of her childhood always patriated her back to the familiar streets of her hometown.
meanings.sent5: The scent of the flowers patriated her senses to the fields of her youth.

meanings.definition: To transfer (a legislative or judicial power) from a colonial authority to a national government.
meanings.sent1: The country was patriating its laws to gain independence from the colonial rulers.
meanings.sent2: The process of patriating legal authority was complex but necessary for self-governance.
meanings.sent3: The old judge joked that he was patriating his gavel to the younger generation.
meanings.sent4: The power of the people patriated the control from the distant rulers to the local government.
meanings.sent5: The ceremony symbolically patriated the sovereignty to the newly formed nation.
